unmetNeeds.title: EGFR T790M Resistance after 3rd-gen TKI
unmetNeeds.description: After osimertinib failure, C797S mutation emerges with no approved therapy
unmetNeeds.discoveryOpportunity: üî• CRITICAL: Urgent unmet need with no approved options

unmetNeeds.title: ALK G1202R Mutation Detection
unmetNeeds.description: Late-emerging resistance mutation poorly detected by standard NGS panels
unmetNeeds.currentGap: Limited diagnostic coverage, tissue biopsy required
unmetNeeds.discoveryOpportunity: Early detection could enable timely treatment switch

unmetNeeds.title: Optimal Sequencing for ALK+ NSCLC
unmetNeeds.description: Unclear which 2nd/3rd-gen ALK inhibitor sequence provides best overall survival
unmetNeeds.discoveryOpportunity: AI/ML analysis of existing data could provide guidance

unmetNeeds.title: EGFR Exon 20 Insertion Mutations
unmetNeeds.description: Poor response to standard EGFR TKIs, limited treatment options
unmetNeeds.currentGap: Only one approved drug (amivantamab), high cost

unmetNeeds.title: EGFR TKI + Natural Compounds Synergy
unmetNeeds.description: Preclinical data shows strong synergy (Curcumin, Artemisinin) but no clinical trials
unmetNeeds.currentGap: No registered clinical trials for herbal compound combinations
potentialSolutions: Phase I/II trials with curcumin + osimertinib

drugRepurposingOpportunities.rationale: AMPK activation inhibits mTOR, synergizes with EGFR TKIs
drugRepurposingOpportunities.preclinicalEvidence: IC50 ~2-10 mM in A549, H1975 cells
drugRepurposingOpportunities.clinicalEvidence: Retrospective studies show improved PFS in diabetic NSCLC patients on metformin
drugRepurposingOpportunities.trialProposal: Phase II: Osimertinib + Metformin vs. Osimertinib alone in 1L EGFR+ NSCLC
drugRepurposingOpportunities.discoveryInsight: üî• LOW-HANGING FRUIT: Safe, cheap, existing data

drugRepurposingOpportunities.rationale: COX-2 inhibition reduces inflammation, may prevent EGFR-driven tumorigenesis
drugRepurposingOpportunities.preclinicalEvidence: Reduced tumor formation in EGFR-mutant mouse models
drugRepurposingOpportunities.clinicalEvidence: Epidemiological data suggests lower NSCLC incidence in aspirin users
drugRepurposingOpportunities.trialProposal: Phase III: Aspirin for NSCLC prevention in EGFR mutation carriers (family history)

drugRepurposingOpportunities.rationale: Blocks protective autophagy that helps cancer cells survive TKI stress
drugRepurposingOpportunities.preclinicalEvidence: Synergizes with gefitinib/erlotinib in resistant cell lines
drugRepurposingOpportunities.clinicalEvidence: Limited Phase I/II data, mixed results
drugRepurposingOpportunities.trialProposal: Phase II: Osimertinib + Hydroxychloroquine with biomarker-selected patients (high autophagy)

knowledgeGaps.description: Different deletion sizes (15bp vs. 18bp) may respond differently to TKIs
knowledgeGaps.researchNeeded: Retrospective analysis of deletion size vs. treatment response

knowledgeGaps.description: No clinical data on dual-resistant mutations
Curcumin/Berberine bioavailability poorly studied in cancer patients
Minimal residual disease detection after surgery or treatment

candidateDiscovery.name: Artemisinin-Osimertinib Combination
candidateDiscovery.hypothesis: Artemisinin induces ferroptosis in T790M cells, synergizing with osimertinib
supportingEvidence: Artemisinin IC50 5-40 ŒºM in H1975 (T790M+) cells
Synergy index 0.3-0.6 (strong synergy) in combination studies
candidateDiscovery.novelty: First natural-synthetic combo targeting ferroptosis + EGFR

candidateDiscovery.name: Ginsenoside Rg3 + Immunotherapy
candidateDiscovery.hypothesis: Rg3 enhances NK cell activity, enabling immunotherapy response in EGFR+ patients
supportingEvidence: Rg3 increases NK cell infiltration in preclinical models
Phase III data in Asia shows survival benefit as adjuvant
EGFR+ NSCLC typically has low PD-L1 and poor immuno response
candidateDiscovery.developmentPath: Phase II: Rg3 + PD-1 inhibitor in EGFR+ NSCLC
candidateDiscovery.novelty: Novel immune priming strategy for cold tumors

candidateDiscovery.name: Curcumin Nanoformulation + EGFR TKI
candidateDiscovery.hypothesis: Nanoparticle delivery achieves therapeutic curcumin levels, synergizing with TKIs
supportingEvidence: Strong in vitro synergy with gefitinib/erlotinib

topOpportunities: EGFR T790M resistance remains #1 unmet need
Natural compound + TKI combinations are underexplored
Korean traditional medicine (Ginseng, Hwangryun) has clinical-stage data
